attributes.additional_details:
To reverse the City of York Council's decision to rip up the cobbled path leading to one of the world’s best-preserved medieval streets, the Shambles in York.

The Council has said the the surface was a hazard to disabled people but surely they can look into alternatives instead of ripping up history.

King’s Square will also be entirely repaved in a scheme that is costing taxpayers almost £500,000, the Council is totally going against the advice of English Heritage.
